items.sentence: If you translate from your second language into your own native language, rather than the other way around, you're less likely to make mistakes.
When writing a sentence, generally you start with a capital letter and finish with a period (.), an exclamation mark (!), or a question mark (?).
Rose, Juniper, Lily, and Camellia were all named after plants, as was Giant Corpse Flower, whose high school experience was far worse than theirs.
When Tom was a kid, he used to pretend he was playing the drums by tapping his fingers on the kitchen table, to the great irritation of his father.
If forests cover 9.4% of the earth's surface, and if forests cover 31% of the earth's land surface, what percent of the earth's surface is not land?
